result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela Denise Spears

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TDH.
Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Pamela Denise Spears in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1 but RETABBED to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible but declined to be interviewed today.
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10-31-2022 @1p
